English: Sickness is spreading on your boat! Treat it with a radioman that has medical training or return to port. Affected sailors:
The sailors are in critical state!
The sailors are dying on board. Stabilize them with a radioman that has medical training as soon as possible.
The sailor is in critical state!
Some sailors have died on board.
We are lacking healthy crew members to fully operate the boat.
Some things on the boat are damaged. Use the engineers to perform the necessary repairs.

Our engineers detected hidden faults on some devices on the boat. They are most likely a result of earlier combat or were caused by pressure deep under the water. Consider repairing them with your engineers as they may cause serious damage in the long term.

Something on the boat has just broken. It seems that the previous combat or pressure deep under the water has left some deeper scars on our boat.

We could potentially locate these flaw points before they were triggered, by having our engineers assigned to the damage control.
Our compressed air reserves are low, making surfacing harder or even impossible. Turn on the compressor on the water surface to replenish your air reserves.
We've received encoded messages. Assign the radioman to Enigma to decode them.
Our radioman received new messages. Click this notification to open your message log.
Skipper, a few sailors on board broke under pressure. They may make noise and need to be taken care of.
At least one of our crewmates have become very aggressive due to the stress. He has to be stopped.
At least one of our crewmates turned out to be a Sea Wolf, a real stoic facing whatever is to come with dignity. Stress peak had no effect.
We have a spy on board!
One of our crewmates has lost it. He may be dangerous and has to be stopped
The crew is no longer hungry
We can send our men on missions nearby!
There are one or more leaks on board!
We picked up active radio transmissions nearby.
We managed to detect a group of units nearby.
Visually detected We have a visual bearing on this vessel.
Detected by the radar detector This vessel is heard by the hydrophone.
Detected by the hydrophone This vessel is heard by the hydrophone.
Alarm This vessel has been alarmed and is ready to fight.
Fire There is a fire on this vessel. As time passes it will cause more damage.
Abandoned The vessel has been abandoned by the crew.
Evacuation The crew tries to abandon the vessel.
Radio The vessel transmits something on the radio.
We are in an area where we expect that some ships are. Submerge and listen to the hydrophone, use the radar detector or just wander around to narrow down their position!
We have unlocked a checkpoint at sea. In exchange for the required resources, we can quickly move to it.
We are in a friendly area with no enemies nearby. Click this notification to quickly travel to your current target.
We have gathered more or less useful intelligence. We can send it to our headquarters at any time by radio.
We managed to detect some vessels nearby.

Our boat has positive buoyancy at this time and will float on the water’s surface during normal conditions.

<color=#ff4c11>Warning: the displayed buoyancy doesn't account for the volume between the hulls that usually slows down submerging for a short time.</color>

Our boat has positive buoyancy at this time and will float on the water’s surface during normal conditions.

The displacement is too low to walk on the upper deck since it is partially or fully under the water.

<color=#ff4c11>Warning: the displayed buoyancy doesn't account for the volume between the hulls that usually slows down submerging for a short time.</color>

Our boat has positive buoyancy at this time and will float on the water’s surface during normal conditions.

The displacement is too low to go outside. Most of the boat is under the water and it would be dangerous for the crew to be outside and for the boat itself.

<color=#ff4c11>Warning: the displayed buoyancy doesn't account for the volume between the hulls that usually slows down submerging for a short time.</color>

Our boat has neutral buoyancy and may freely change its submersion depth using the vertical steers.

<color=#ff4c11>Warning: the displayed buoyancy doesn't account for the volume between the hulls that usually slows down submerging for a short time.</color>
Our boat has negative buoyancy, but for the most part, it's still possible to compensate using the engines.
Our boat has negative buoyancy and is sinking!
The quality of air inside the boat is very low.
Discipline on the boat is very low and because of it your crew is very susceptible to stress during combat. Consider returning back to the port and sending your crew on a vacation.
Your crew is strained and stressed
Crew is no longer strained and stressed
The batteries are close to depletion
The energy in the batteries is at a very low level.
The batteries are close to depletion
The fuel is close to depletion
We are running out of fuel.
The fuel is close to depletion
Our boat is currently at a depth that poses some danger to parts exposed to external pressure.
Our boat is currently at a depth for which the boat’s hull was not designed. Move closer to the surface as the hull might be crushed at any moment!
Our boat is now on the open sea, far from anything else. Travel speed on the map is now much faster.
Supply ship has reached the target square!
This task will be completed in {0}.
This task was completed! Visit Headquarters to receive rewards.

We are not sure about our boat's current location. Our boat's position won't be dynamically updated on the map. Send officer to the navigator's station to make him determine our current position back again. 
Note: You can keep officer at the navigator's station when travelling long distances on the open sea to prevent this.
Cannot travel to a checkpoint during alarm.
Cannot travel to a checkpoint when u-boat's position isn't known.
At least one of the sailors has got a heart attack due to stress and his underlying health condition.

Our boat interiors accumulated some dirt as they weren't cleaned for an extended period of time. This will make our crew a bit unhappy.

Ensure that a cleaner is assigned to work in the Management screen to eliminate this penalty.
We don't have any sailors working at vital places of the boat:
? Engines are currently not manned. We won't be able to move.
? Sailors performing observations at the conning tower are missing despite our boat being surfaced. We won't see anything around us.
? Missing sailors at the depth steers station. We won't be able to dive or intentionally change our depth.
? We don't have any sailor working at the helmsman station. We won't be able to turn our boat around.
Electric engines are now preferred over diesel engines
They will be used even on the sea surface until this order is dismissed. You can do that by opening the telegraph from the top bar and clicking a button labelled as "Diesel Motors".
Electric engines are now preferred over diesel engines
Your home port has fallen to the enemy! Head to {0} for further orders.
Radio transmission detected by the enemy!

Key: Radio Transmission Detected By Enemy Description
English: Skipper, enemy started an alarm and it seems likely that they detected our radio transmission.

We are in shallow waters.
Watch out for shoals!

The determined course and position of our boat is imprecise.
Send an officer to the navigator's station!
Skipper, we have a few survivors on board. We tried to accommodate them in a limited space of a submarine. We can leave them at the nearest port or supply ship for a small reward.
We are in an area, where there is a high risk of encountering various anti-submarine defences like mines and nets. Act carefully skipper!
Due to a weak signal, bad weather or some other reason, currently received transmission has been interrupted.

One of our resupply ships was sunk by the enemy. 
Coordinates: {0} (square {1})
We are running low on the spare parts. If they are depleted, we won't be able to patch leaks or perform other major repairs.
We don't have any spare parts in the storage. We won't be able to patch leaks or perform other major repairs.
There is no free space on the drive. The game state wasn't saved.
Skipper, we've detected an aircraft nearby.
Skipper, we've spotted a funnel smoke over horizon.
Skipper, our radioman is reporting that he heard propellers at some distance.
? Damage: {0} This equipment was damaged. We will have to use replacement parts to repair it.
? Minor damage: {0} This equipment was damaged, but luckily it's an easy one and fixing it won't require replacement parts.
A material fatigue has appeared after taking a recent damage. It's a matter of time when it breaks. We need to hurry.
A surface exposed to external pressure has became weaker after taking a recent damage. It won't withstand the pressure exerted by water, if we dive deeper.
This damage wasn't noticeable at first, but this equipment is currently not useable.
Due to material fatigue from the recent damage, this equipment became vulnerable to any further stress. It will easily break, if we receive any further damage.
A material fatigue has appeared after taking a recent damage. It was a matter of time when it would break.
A surface exposed to external pressure has became weaker after taking a recent damage. It couldn't withstand the pressure exerted by water when we dived deeper.
This damage wasn't noticeable at first. A crewman has noticed that this device was broken by recent damage when he tried to do some work on it.
Due to material fatigue from the recent damage, this equipment became vulnerable to any further damage. It broken when we were hit again.
Our boat requires an inspection for hidden flaws

Skipper, our boat was recently damaged by the enemy. There may be some damages on the boat of which we are not aware.

You can assign an engineer or a radioman to the command station in the control room along with a few sailors to perform a full check of the boat.
Alarm! The crew works harder at a cost of increased stress.

Skipper, there is an active alarm on our ship. You can disable it at any time using the telegraph. When the alarm is active, it has the following effects:
? Crew's work performance is increased.
? Officers have new activities available at the command station in the control room.
? Officers will continue to work, even if their energy drops to zero and will refuse to rest.
? Stress is growing among the crew and discipline falls.

For the last reason, alarms are not sustainable for the long periods of time. Use them wisely, skipper!
Something is being loaded in the background...

Command station Officers present here provide various ship-wide benefits, depending on their commanding skills and a number of assigned sailors to them. This station is available only during an alarm.
? Leader (officer's class): Add sailors to the officer to increase work performance on the ship.
? Engineer (officer's class): Assigned sailors search for hidden flaws. Damage done to the internal devices -{0}%.
? Engineer (officer's class): Add sailors to the officer to search for hidden flaws and protect the internal equipment from an incoming damage.
? Radioman (officer's class): Assigned sailors search for hidden flaws.
? Radioman (officer's class): Add sailors to the officer to search for hidden flaws.
? Iron Fist (skill): Crew and torpedo loading noise -{0}%.
? Mechanic (skill): Damage done to the internal devices -{0}%.
? Mechanic (skill): Add sailors to the officer to protect the internal equipment from an incoming damage.
